Articles.Content:
Hello everyone, I just wanted to introduce myself here. I've sunk a little over 10 hours into the game so far, and I'm addicted. I have enjoyed reading the forums and they have helped me a lot, so I thought I would be a lurker no more!

So far I have:


  2. Put a satellite (and later, a Kerbin) in Low Kerbin Orbit.
  3. I've landed a rover on the Mun (and promptly rolled it over 30 meters later).
  4. My latest accomplishment was landing a Kerbal via a detached lander on the Mun, planting a flag, rendezvousing with the larger space ship, and bringing the Kerbals back in one piece.

Next up: Kerbal Space Station!

Notes so far:

- Rendezvousing is hard. Rendezvousing is less hard when learning about the NavBall's reference point operations. I spent a silly amount of delta-v and time rendezvousing by eye during the mun mission.- My wife saw me playing. She thinks Kerbals are cute, and has told me if a single one of them is harmed in the making of space science that I will suffer dearly.

Slow and steady will be my pace. I think once the station is done I'll aim for Duna, and after that then maybe Jool or Eve. Eve scares me right now.

I really enjoy the game, I think it's a great idea for all ages, and I wish the best for the development team. Until next time, fly safe!
Welcome, and good luck. And I'm so glad people like your wife exist in this world xD
Kerbin is the planet, and a Kerbal is a silly green creature.
